column1: 1. According to Section 4(c) of the IPC, Indian courts have jurisdiction over cybercrimes if:
column2: A) The offense is committed within India's borders
column3: B) The offense targets an Indian server or network, even if committed from abroad
column4: C) The offender is a citizen of India
column5: D) The offense occurs on a website hosted in India
column6: Answer: B) The offense targets an Indian server or network, even if committed from abroad

column1: 2. Which of the following cases confirmed the applicability of the IPC to offenses committed outside India by Indian citizens?
column2: A) State of Maharashtra v. Natwarlal (1970)
column3: B) M. K. Ghosh v. Union of India (1992)
column5: D) S. R. Bansal v. Union of India (2005)
column6: Answer: C) R. v. Moti Ram (1950)

column1: 3. What legal issue does Section 5 of the IPC primarily address?
column3: B) Precedence of special and local laws over the IPC
column6: Answer: B) Precedence of special and local laws over the IPC

column1: 4. In the case of A.R. Antulay v. R.S. Nayak (1984), what did the Supreme Court rule concerning the application of laws?
column2: A) IPC takes precedence over special laws
column3: B) Special laws, such as the Prevention of Corruption Act, supersede the IPC
column4: C) Local laws are invalid if they conflict with the IPC
column5: D) Section 5 does not apply to corruption cases
column6: Answer: B) Special laws, such as the Prevention of Corruption Act, supersede the IPC

column1: 5. What was the primary legal change after the abrogation of Article 370 in 2019 regarding the Indian Penal Code (IPC)?
column2: A) The IPC was abolished across India
column3: B) The IPC was extended to Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh
column4: C) The IPC was replaced by the Ranbir Penal Code
column5: D) Criminal law was decentralized to each state
column6: Answer: B) The IPC was extended to Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh

column1: 6. Which of the following real-life cases is an example of Section 2 of the IPC being applied to a foreign national?
column2: A) David Headley Case (2008 Mumbai terror attacks)
column5: D) Harshad Mehta Stock Market Scandal
column6: Answer: A) David Headley Case (2008 Mumbai terror attacks)

column1: 7. In the Italian Marines Case, why were the marines charged under the IPC?
column2: A) The crime was committed in Indian territorial waters
column3: B) The marines were Indian citizens
column4: C) The crime took place in Italy
column5: D) The marines requested to be tried under Indian law
column6: Answer: A) The crime was committed in Indian territorial waters
